node.title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
node.alt: This building in Greenpoint was built in 1931.
node.description: Recent commercial real estate transactions in New York.
node.content: ["$2.95 MILLION", "640 Manhattan Avenue (between Norman and Nassau Avenues)", "Brooklyn", "This 4,875-square-foot, three-story building in Greenpoint was built in 1931 and has one commercial space and two three-bedroom apartments. The building was delivered vacant.", "Buyers: Max Koshkerman and Oren Halali", "Buyers\u2019 Broker: Michael Sherman of Baseline Real Estate Advisors", "Seller: Howard Berke", "Seller\u2019s Brokers: Derek Bestreich, Luke Sproviero, Donal Flaherty, Hakeem Lecky and Corey Haynes of Bestreich Realty Group", "$11.25 MILLION", "9 Spring Street (between Elizabeth Street and Bowery)", "Manhattan", "Built in 1900, this 13,403-square-foot, seven-story building in NoLIta has 26 one-bedroom apartments, two of them vacant and all rent-stabilized, and two retail units. One is occupied by Aberizk, a clothing store with a focus on up-and-coming independent designers. The other is vacant.", "Buyer: OR 9 Spring L.L.C.", "Seller: 9 Spring L.L.C.", "Brokers: Matt Fotis, Robert Aaron, Colton Traynham, Jonathan Zarin of Marcus & Millichap", "$13.75 MILLION", "130-20 Farmers Boulevard (at Merrick Boulevard)", "Queens", "This 19,190-square-foot, two-story building in St. Albans was built last year and has two commercial units and a 47-space parking lot. The ground floor is leased to CityMD through September 2035, and the second floor is leased to Blink Fitness through January 2035.", "Seller: 13020 Farmers L.L.C.", "Brokers: Stephen R. Preuss, Kevin Schmitz, Kevin Louie and Andreas Efthymiou of Ripco Real Estate"]
